pr_title: MDEV-12933: Sort out the compression library chaos
pr_body:
Re-opens #1667 

This patch removes the compile-time dependency on compression libraries, and loads them during run time instead.
- The first commit creates a new switch for `mariadbd`/`mysqld` called `--use-compression=`, which allows the user to specify the libraries to be loaded on startup.  
- The next 6 commits add one service each. 
  In order: `LZMA`, `LZO`, `Snappy`, `BZip2`, `ZStd` and `LZ4`.  
- The next few commits contain workarounds that need to be fixed before merging.
  RocksDB has deeper integration with libraries than the other storage engines, so it needs access to more functions.
  The extra functions needed for RocksDB are in separate commits so that they can be removed easily if required.  
- The next commit adds tests.
- Finally, the last commit adds `sql/compression/README.md` that contains instructions to create a new compression service.
pr_review_comments:
[{'comment_id': 700412231, 'comment_body': '@vuvova Did you decide that the MariaDB Server should from now on support all compression methods? I was under the impression that somebody was to do benchmarks and then select only a couple compression methods instead of having them all.', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2021, 9, 1, 17, 15, 39, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'ottok', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 700413518, 'comment_body': 'Why are these 4 different packages? Seems a bit over-engineered. Why not include those 4 .so libraries in the server (with current code they are all build anyway) and then just let users choose what compression method they want to use via a config option?', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2021, 9, 1, 17, 17, 33, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'ottok', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 700417853, 'comment_body': 'Yes, because now they come "for free", they don't bring any extra dependencies, so we can enable them all, no trade-offs anymore.', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2021, 9, 1, 17, 23, 45, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'vuvova', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 700420878, 'comment_body': 'This is the whole purpose of this task. The user decides what compression methods they wants and will only need to install those libraries. There is no need to install libraries one doesn't use.

The whole issue of "do benchmarks" and "not enable all compression methods" was about a choice what run-time dependencies to enable to satisfy as many users as possible, but without adding too many dependencies.

And this was, generally, impossible to solve. Because nobody uses or needs *all* compression libraries, but for every compression library there was somebody who needed it. That is, everybody — every single user — was forced to install libraries they didn't need only because someone in the world might've needed them.

Now we've solved it, a user only installs libraries they want to use.', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2021, 9, 1, 17, 28, 7, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'vuvova', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 700785248, 'comment_body': "1) Maybe plugin name should be mariadb-plugin-compression-bzip2 ? Would better indicate what it is about. For an average DBA 'provider' is very inspecific.

2) Do we have a CI that has built these .deb packages or do I need to rebuild this myself? I am planning to check what dependencies the packages actually end up with. If the goal is to avoid unnecessary dependencies, we need to verify the list of the dependencies of the server before and after this change.", 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2021, 9, 2, 6, 32, 45, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'ottok', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 700825752, 'comment_body': '1. Debian pattern is `mariadb-plugin-<plugin name>`, for example `mariadb-plugin-rocksdb`. The plugin is called "provider_bzip2" because in the future we plan to use it for more then just compression. I was hoping that "bzip2" part is specific enough, and error messages saying "you're trying to use bzip2 compression, but its provider plugin is not installed" will also help.

2. Absolutely. Packages are here: http://hasky.askmonty.org/archive/bb-10.7-release/build-42268/', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2021, 9, 2, 7, 35, 46, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'vuvova', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 702363559, 'comment_body': "1. All of the plugins provide something. I simply think that the term 'provider' is redundant here. Shorter would be sweeter. But as they say, naming is one of the hard things in computer science..
2. Ok, I have verified that the dependencies are correctly separated.", 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2021, 9, 5, 4, 27, 27, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'ottok', 'type': 'User'}]
